title: Kentucky Fruit Filling Recipe
description: A fruity filling for a fruity cake. Try it with the Heritage Jam Cake.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Fillings Fruit Fillings Kentucky Fruit Filling 3.0 (1) 1 Review 3 Photos A fruity filling for a fruity cake. Try it with the Heritage Jam Cake. Submitted by barbara Updated on August 22, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 3 Servings: 12 Yield: 2 cups filling Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 1 cup dates, pitted and chopped 1 cup chopped raisins 1 large orange ⅓ cup white sugar ¼ cup orange juice Directions Cut orange into sections, and remove the seeds. Grind the sections, peels and all. Combine dates, raisins, and ground orange in a medium saucepan: stir well. Stir in sugar and orange juice. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture is thickened. Spread hot filling between layers or on top of cake. Add Your Photo Photos of Kentucky Fruit Filling 01 of 03 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 03 Photo by  Caroline 08/22/2011 This was easy to make, however I didn't like the orange with the dates and raisins. I can see how it could go well with the Heritage Jam Cake, but I wasn't a fan. Next time I try this filling, I will use tart apples - not sure if that will work. Otherwise, I'll just make the cake with a different topping altogether. 1 You’ll Also Love Kentucky Banana Pudding 171 Ratings Kentucky Bourbon Cake 28 Ratings Kentucky Pecan Pie 273 Ratings Lemon Custard Filling 72 Ratings Grapefruit Curd 1 Rating Kentucky Derby Pie 14 Ratings My Kentucky Derby Dessert 16 Ratings Heide's Kentucky Derby Dessert 33 Ratings Lemon Snow Filling 33 Ratings Elderflower Lemon Curd 1 Rating Steph's Bourbon Balls 18 Ratings Lemon Pastry Cream 3 Ratings Mario's Coconut Lemon Curd 1 Rating Lemon Curd 104 Ratings Blood Orange Curd T's Maple-Vanilla Apple Pie Filling 1 Rating Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: barbara
instructions: Cut orange into sections, and remove the seeds. Grind the sections, peels and all.;Combine dates, raisins, and ground orange in a medium saucepan: stir well. Stir in sugar and orange juice. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture is thickened.;Spread hot filling between layers or on top of cake.
